item.title: Simple Wayfire Keybind
item.description: Some simple Wayfire custom keybind ScreenShot You can use grim and slurp to have screenshot function grim screenshot slurp select a region Install grim and slurp yay -S grim slurp For example shell script # ~/.config/wayfire/scripts/screenshot.sh path="/home/novel2430/Pictures/screenshot/" # <--- Where you want to save your screenshots now_date=$(date '+%Y%m%d-%H%M%S') file_name="${path}${now_date}.png" msg="save as ${file_name}" case $1 in full) grim ${file_name} && dunstify -a "Screenshot" "Full" "${msg}" -r 2003 ;; select) grim -g

item.title: Basic Wayfire Applications
item.description: Applications on Wayfire Setup Wayfire Basic Environment [ App Menu ] (wofi) yay -S wofi # ~/.config/wayfire.ini ... # Start your launcher # https://hg.sr.ht/~scoopta/wofi # Note: Add mode=run or mode=drun to ~/.config/wofi/config. # You can also specify the mode with --show option. binding_launcher = <super> KEY_D # <-- Change key binding command_launcher = wofi --show drun # <-- Change exec command ... [ Web Browser ] (firefox) yay -S firefox

item.title: Basic Archlinux Wayfire Install
item.description: Basic ArchLinux(UEFI) + WayFire Install Basic Arch Install [ Check UEFI or BIOS ] ls /sys/firmware/efi/efivars If the directory not exist, you are not in UEFI mode. [ Internet ] Check system activate internet interface ip link For Ethernet (DHCP) Good to go! For WiFi (iwd) enter interactive prompt iwctl list all wifi device [iwd] device list select the device you want to use, i.e: wlan0 and start scanning [iwd]
